pr_title: exception if --privacy-marker-transaction-signing-key-file not specified in non-zero-gas network

timeline.message:
exception if min-gas-price > 0 and pmt key file not specified

Signed-off-by: Sally MacFarlane <sally.macfarlane@consensys.net>

reverted change to API

Signed-off-by: Sally MacFarlane <sally.macfarlane@consensys.net>

timeline.author: mark-terry

replies.bodyText: this sort of thing appears in the help both ways. If we're going to make it consistent that would be a bigger change than this PR.
replies.author: macfarla

timeline.bodyText:
"Private transactions cannot be signed by random (non-funded) accounts in paid gas networks"
Would you expect a user to connect that not specifying a key file will mean a random account is used? I'm not sure whether we can expect the user to have enough context to understand the last sentence.
timeline.author: mark-terry

replies.bodyText: I got that from reading the docs. I think if you're using privacy you should read the docs. Also I asked @MadelineMurray to preapprove this error message
replies.author: macfarla

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to rely on a default non-zero gas price, or would it be clearer to have an explicit non-zero gas price?
timeline.author: mark-terry

replies.bodyText: changing this is outside the scope of this PR
replies.author: macfarla
